Yugoslav ambassador gives reception 
    Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Yugoslav ambassador to Korea Milorad Kosovac hosted a reception at the embassy on Thursday on the occasion of the constitutional day of the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia.
 Invited to the reception were minister of foreign trade Ri Kwang Gun, vice-minister of foreign affairs Choe Su Hon and officials concerned and diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations in Korea.    
 Speeches were made there.

Personal letter to Kim Jong Il from Namibian President 
    Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Namibian President Sam Nujoma sent his personal letter to leader Kim Jong Il.
 The letter was handed to an official concerned by Nahas Angula, minister of higher education, training and employment creation who is leading the Namibian government delegation on a visit to Korea.

Swiss committee for celebrations of Feb. 16, 2002, formed 
    Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The Swiss Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification and the Cultural Information Center on the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, Lausanne, Switzerland, on April 15 formed a Swiss preparatory committee for celebrating February 16, 2002, the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
 Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Swiss Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, was selected chairman of the preparatory committee.    
 The preparatory committee has set a celebration period from April 15 this year to February 16 next year.

Portugal-Korea Friendship Association reorganized 
    Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held in Lisbon on April 19 to reorganize the Portugal-Korea Friendship Association for the purpose of expanding the organization.
 Miguel Boieiro, mayor of Alcochete, was elected chairman of the association.    
 At the meeting he said that the reorganization of the association in the first year of the 21st century is a manifestation of the Portuguese people's will to further strengthen and develop the friendship and solidarity with the Korean people on a new higher stage.

articles.content:
Greetings to Yugoslav President 
    Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, on April 24 sent a message of greetings to Yugoslav President Vojislav Kostunica on the occasion of the constitutional day of the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the interests of the two peoples and wished the president and people of Yugoslavia greater success in their work for stability, development and the territorial integrity of the country.    
 Meanwhile, premier of the DPRK cabinet Hong Song Nam sent a message of greetings to Yugoslav prime minister Zoran Zizic and foreign minister Paek Nam Sun to his Yugoslav counterpart Goran Svilanovic.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Sierra Leone
articles.content:
Greetings to Togolese President
    Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Togolese President Gnassingbe Eyadema on Wednesday on the occasion of the 41st anniversary of the Independence of Togo.
 The message extended warm congratulations to the president and people of Togo on this occasion.    
 It expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries and the two peoples would grow stronger in the future and wished the Togolese President and people greater success in their work for the stability and prosperity of the country and the unity and peace of the African region.
